CIPHER.0.cipherString: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: I think the whole tension about romanticism is the way it builds and builds, and the moment it's consummated, the tension's over.
CIPHER.1.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.2.cipherString: So full of artless jealousy is guilt, It spills itself in fearing to be spilt.
CIPHER.2.question: Solve this aristocrat. The letter C maps to S.

CIPHER.3.cipherString: I don't have a sidekick - no Ed McMahon. So when I go out there, I'm lonely. It's scary.
CIPHER.3.question: Solve this aristocrat. The first word is I.

CIPHER.4.cipherString: Were it not for imagination, Sir, a man would be as happy in the arms of a chambermaid as of a Duchess.
CIPHER.4.question: Solve this patristocrat.

CIPHER.5.cipherString: I believe in large families: every woman should have at least three husbands.
CIPHER.5.question: Solve this patristocrat. The letter W maps to O.

CIPHER.6.cipherString: The older I get, the more open-minded I get, the less judgmental I get.

CIPHER.7.cipherString: El deporte delega en el cuerpo algunas de las virtudes más fuertes del alma: la energía, la audacia, la paciencia
CIPHER.7.question: Solve this xenocrypt. The letter  maps to W.

CIPHER.8.cipherString: I always give a lot of credit to Ronnie Dunn for making me fall in love with country music.
CIPHER.8.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(7,10).

CIPHER.9.cipherString: I think that I've tried many times to get Cuba in my writings, especially Havana, which was once a great and fascinating city.
CIPHER.9.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(9,16).

CIPHER.10.cipherString: I had a lot of growing up to do. A lot of times, I learned the hard way.
CIPHER.10.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters E and S map to F and P.

CIPHER.11.cipherString: I was one of the many horses pulling the wagon and couldn't escape left or right because of the will of the driver.
CIPHER.11.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Caesar cipher.

CIPHER.12.cipherString: God is a God who has not given up on His people. If He wanted to give up, He would have given up back in the Garden of Eden.
CIPHER.12.question: Encode this sentence with the Caesar cipher with offset 17.

CIPHER.13.cipherString: The break down for kids is communication. Music helps bring that bond.

CIPHER.14.cipherString: My love, growing up on the Prairies, was country music.

CIPHER.15.cipherString: We actually have a real community of people doing useful things.

CIPHER.16.cipherString: I hated school, but I was a good student. I made straight A's.

CIPHER.17.cipherString: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

CIPHER.18.cipherString: Don't blame the marketing department. The buck stops with the chief executive.

CIPHER.19.cipherString: I think by writing about a place with great specificity, you manage to make it universal.

CIPHER.20.cipherString: We Jews have a secret weapon in our struggle with the Arabs; we have no place to go.
